Key: So, that's how it is...
*Sniffle* I see, I see. What a touching effort...!

All right! Then I'll pitch in for your sake,
Tohka-chan!
Hey Ai, do you mean...?!
Hmm...?

That's right, these are VIP tickets to Tengu
Cinema! With these, you can choose to see
any movie at any time, in any seat, with anyone!
Ai! Weren't you planning to use those yourself―

Don't say any more! Or Tohka-chan's gonna end up
refusing...!

T-Tohka-chan...! Just keep quiet and please accept
them...!

Please... Let Ai be the generous woman we all know
she is!
Y-Yes...!
Take those, and invite Itsuka-kun to the movies!
I-I'll... invite him...

Tohka-chan, love requires strategy! There are
times when it's bad to be a woman who walks one
step back, or is modest, or always serving a man!

It's called the ol' "push and pull"! You have to
push once... and then pull him back in again.

Hmm... This is difficult... That wasn't written
in the "man-gazine"...

Well, it does make a good reference for many
things...

As necessary as it is to a woman's arsenal,
it won't solve every problem.

In fact, if you end up thinking that everything
is listed in there, there's a good chance you'll
have the rug pulled out from under you, you know?
I-Is that so...?

Right. So it's important to put it to practice and
refine your sense of strategy as you go along.

For example, the article that says when you get an
e-mail from your love interest, it's good to wait
and tease them for about a day before replying...

But people's sense of time differs, so you might
end up missing your chance by making them wait.
Who knows, someone could even steal your man...
Th-That would be bad!

Right? So you don't have to follow it word-for-word.
There are lots of things not written in it.

So, that's why today she'll try pushing with those
tickets?!
Exactly!
Hm... It may be the best time to act...
H-How do I invite him? I-If he refuses―

Ahh, no worries, we have a secret plan ready!
So you see... *whisper, whisper, whisper*...

Whoops! The Itsuka-kun of your dreams has
just come out! All right then, Tohka-chan!
Just like I said, do your best!
Y-Yes...!

It's all about that gap! The gap!
Between the ideal ladylike modesty, and the
aggressive advances of a confidant woman!

Push, then pull! Be forceful when you invite him!
But be graceful and reserved during the movie!
Then you'll win it!
Yes! I'm grateful for your advice! I-I will try!
Mai! Mii! We shouldn't get in the way! Let's go!

(Huh? Wasn't that the Ai Mai Mii Trio that ran
by just now...?)
(Hmm... Over there, is that...?)
Heeeey, Tohka! So you were here all along?
Sh-Shido!
What were you doing?
Um! N-Nothing!

I-I see...
Well, I was about to invite you on a da―
W-Wait Shido! I-I must be the one to invite you!
Uh... Huh?

J-Just wait a moment!
Wh-When I invite him, it must be... forcefully...
Sh-Shido... P-Please... I-I want...
Wha―?!

(As Tohka twisted herself into a strange pose,
she approached while waving around some tickets.
Um, what is this weird movement...?)
...Y-You to take...
Whoa?! Hey! Tohka?!
...M-Me to the movies...

(Wh-What the...! This isn't good! The blood's
rushing to my face!)

(I bet the Ai Mai Mii Trio told her something
weird and... this is the result of a huge
misunderstanding...!)

(Th-This is bad! I have to hurry and get away!
Whoa, Tohka's holding on with all her strength!)

Gaaah! I-I'll take you! I'll take you, so please
let go for a sec!
Ohh! Is it really all right?!
Y-Yeah...!

(I was already going to invite
her on a date anyway.)

All right, it was a success...! After this,
I shall be graceful and reserved at the theater...
Then Shido will be infatuated with me...!
Wh-What are you mumbling about...?

Ah! I-It's nothing!
More importantly, please hurry
and take me to the movies!

(Hm? The thing she was waving around just now
looked like movie tickets.)

Oh! Are these VIP tickets for Tengu City Cinema?
These give you priority access so you can see
whatever you want.
Is that something amazing?

There are times when you end up having to stand in
order to watch popular movies. But with these
tickets, you can sit in reserved seating.
I see, then let's go right away!

With these tickets, there's no need to rush, so
let's go home for now and leave our stuff there.
Yes! Let us do that!

(This time of day, there are quite
a lot of people...)

(Now then, I wonder what movies are showing...
It'd be nice if there were movies Tohka would want
to see...)
Shido?
What's is it? Did you find a movie you like?

No, it's not that. For a while now, there's been
a fragrant smell drifting around, but...?
Oh, that's probably the smell of popcorn.
Hm? Pop...corn? What is that?

Oh right, you've never tried it. It's a snack you
make by heating up corn kernels. There's a salted
flavor and a sweet flavor... Do you want to try?
Yes! I would like to eat it!

Then once we've decided on a movie, let's buy
popcorn and some kind of drink, then go inside.

Hm, go inside? Is there somewhere
else to go from here?
(S-Somewhere else to go...)
T-Tohka? Can I ask one thing?
What?
Do you know what a movie is?

I heard it is like watching a large television.
Am I wrong?

Er, well that's about right, but...
You invited me without really knowing
what a movie is?

Hmph! Don't misunderstand me! I didn't invite
you because I wanted to see a movie! I invited
you because I wanted to be with you, Shido!
I-I see...! E-Err... um...
Hm, what's wrong?!

N-No, it's nothing!
Well, for now, I'll explain what a movie's like,
all right?
Yes, please do!

―So put simply, like you said before, you watch
a screen like a large TV in a huge room with a
bunch of other people.
Hmmm, I see...

Hm? It's Kotori. I wonder what it is...
Tohka, wait just a sec.
All right.
Shido, you're in the middle of a date with\nTohka, right? It looks like it's going well.
You can tell if it's going well or not?
If we monitor Tohka's mental graph, it's obvious.\nBut we are having troubling linking with your\npositional information. Where are you right now?
At Tengu Cinema.
Hmmm, a movie date. So... have you decided what\nmovie to watch?
No, we're about to choose now.
I see, then we'll support you, dummy. Just so\nthat the date doesn't fail from your movie\nchoice.
Sorry for being a dummy!
Yeah, yeah, keep complaining. For now, we'll\nnarrow down the movie genres from here!

I-I see... It looks like there are a lot,
so it'd be helpful.
Usually, I'd tell you the titles, but with the\ncurrent state of the Fraxinus, it's impossible.\nYou'll have to judge for yourself from there.
Hmm, got it.
We will reference both data from normal girls as\nwell as Tohka to supply you with possible choices\nto compare with the movies at your location.
Even that much is helpful.
All right, there it is... I'll send it now.
Right.
Be careful in determining what Tohka would like.\nEven one mistake could lead to a stressful night,\nand possibly have her lose control, you got it?
I-I'll be careful...
Well then, I'll pray for the success\nof your date.

(Hmmm, Sci-fi adventure, romance, and horror
genres, huh... Which would be good for Tohka?)
3-D blockbuster! Sci-fi adventure!
Here come the waterworks! A tale of pure romance!
It's here! A classic summer horror movie!

(Yeah, I feel like the super-curious Tohka would
like this. It feels like something anyone can
enjoy without having to think too much...)

(The question is, what sci-fi movies are they
showing right now... Hmm... That, huh...?
Looks like it'll do the trick.)
All right, Tohka, let's go see that!

Hm...while watching a movie...
graceful and reserved...
Heeeey, Tohka?
...H-Hmmm?! Wh-Wh-What's wrong, Shido?!

Ah no, I was just saying that this would be a good
movie to see...

Hm?! I-I see! I am good with anything as long as
I can watch it with you, Shido!

Uh...! Er... I-I'm sure you'll enjoy it too,
Tohka.

Um... It's a 3D movie called "Captain Joker. 
You can see a lot of things pop out at you
from the screen. Doesn't it sound interesting?"

Ohh! It sounds like fun!
Let us hurry and go, then!

W-Wait just a sec!
We're gonna go buy popcorn and drinks, right?
Ah! That's right!

We still have time until it starts. All right,
let's go, Tohka.
Yes!

(As predicted, the movie isn't anything too deep.
But since they spent so much on CGI, it's easy
to watch without getting bored.)

(Even Tohka, who at first was strangely restless
and stiff, is now glued to the screen.)

(A mysterious message from the vessel arrives
—"Argh, the spiders! The spiders!"—
before suddenly cutting out.)

(The solar system is ensnared by the giant space
spiders, wrapping stars in webs while traveling,
and transforming it into a great spider's nest.)

(Earth is completely enveloped in a cocoon, and
the people can no longer see the blue sky. The
space wanderer, Captain Joker, comes to save them.)

(Creeping along the threads connecting the
planets, the spiders devour the people on Mars and
the Moon, then soon make their way toward Earth.)

(The sky, wrapped up in a white cocoon, is eaten
apart, and the Batchula descend in droves to wrap
people up in webbing and slowly prey upon them!)

A-Aaaaaaahhh! Sh-Shido! It's dangerous!
Th-The spider! The spider web! It's coming
this way!

Whoa...! T-Tohka...?!
I-It's okay! It's just a movie!
It only looks like it's jumping out!
Hey, be quiet! I can't hear the movie!
I-I'm sorry...!

I-I apologize, Shido... I couldn't
help but get caught up...!

No... it's fine, but you have to be quiet in
a theater, okay...?
Y-Yes... I was trying to, but―

Hm?! Sh-Shido!
"Captain Joker" is in danger!

C-Curse you giant spiders! How cowardly to attack
in such large numbers!
H-Hey...!

He's outnumbered that way! All right!
I will help him with Sandalphon―

T-T-T-Tohka?!
Stop! Stop!!

―Hm?! Oh?! I've done it again...!
I-I apologize, Shido!
H-Hey! You're scattering popcorn everywhere!

You there! You're being noisy!
If you wanna make a scene, do it outside!
I-I'm so sorry...!

(Despite piercing stares, we managed to get
through the whole movie, although I had slunk down
in my seat and couldn't concentrate on the story...)

Hm... Why do I always end up doing
something like this?

Don't let it get to you so much. It was your
first movie, and a 3D one at that. It can't
be helped that you'd get really worked up.
Sh-Shido... have you become infatuated with me?
Wh-Wh—?

I-It is nothing! Forget about it!
I apologize, but I'll head home first...!
H-Hey! Tohka...!

(Hmmm... did I mess up with the movie selection?
It looked like she was enjoying it, but maybe it
was pushing it to ask Tohka to stay quiet...)
Hey... Tohka's mental state's gotten pretty\nunstable, you know?

Well, it was going fine until a certain point...
She got so into the movie and was so loud that
we got scolded. She seems depressed now...
I see. Well, I guess it was her first time...\nSo, what did you end up watching?
A science fiction flick, Captain Joker.
...While her mental graph gets tense halfway,\nher enjoyment metrics scored really high. It\nlooks like you had the right idea, at least.
I-I wonder...
It's just that your guidance and support skills\nwere lacking.
―Urgh!
Conversely... You could say we made it through\n with just this outcome because it was you,\nShido.
Huh...?

You're really dense... Speaking of which,
what's Tohka doing?"	
Message	Shido	"W-Well, she said she'd go home first,
so she left by herself―
Why didn't you say so?! Didn't I tell you that we\ncan't monitor your positional info from here?!\nFind her right now and follow up, dumbass!
You're right... I have to support Tohka.

(Even if she's a Spirit, Tohka still seems like
a regular girl. I hope she'll like this kind of
romance movie...)

(As for whether or not I'd want to see it...
It's complicated.)

(A tear-jerker romance... It'd be nice if there was a
good one― Oh, this looks good!)
All right, Tohka, let's go see that!

Hm...while watching a movie...
graceful and reserved...
Heeeey, Tohka?
...H-Hmmm?! Wh-Wh-What's wrong, Shido?!

Ah, nothing. I was just saying I decided which
movie we should watch.

Hm?! I-I see! I am good with anything
as long as I can watch it with you, Shido!

Uh...! Er... I-I'm sure you'll enjoy
it too, Tohka.

Umm... It's called "One Last Week," which is based
on a best-selling novel...

One Last Week?! That seems quite interesting!
Then let us hurry and watch!

W-Wait just a sec!
We're gonna go buy popcorn and drinks, right?
Ah! That's right!

It looks like we still have time until the movie
starts, so let's head to the concession stand.
Yes!

(As I predicted, it was a romance about a
terminally-ill lover... The concept's so overdone,
I really doubt it'll be much of a tear-jerker.)

(However, Tohka, who was strangely restless at
first, was now glued to the screen... It's almost
at the climax, too.)

(I guess she was the typical girly girl,
after all...)
Ohh... *sniffle*...!
Huh...? Huh...?!

Waaaahhh...! *sniffle*...*sniff*...! Sh-Shido!
Wh-Why... Why is it so?! Uwaaaaaah...!
T-Tohka...! A-Are you okay...?

Hey...! Keep it down over there! This is a good
scene, so shut up already!
I-I'm sorry...!

*Sniffle*...! *Sniffle*...! Shido...
I'm sorry... Th-The bride and... the groom
are... j-just so pitiable and... *sniffle*...

No... it's fine, but you have to be quiet in
a theater, okay...?

*Sniffle*...! I-I am trying, but... I feel so bad
for them... I-I'm sorry... Shido...!

B-But still... *sniffle*! Is there... *sniffle*...
nothing that can be done... for the groom...?
W-Well, this is a movie, so...
...*Sniffle*...urgh...*sniffle*...!
...T-Tohka?
W-Waaaaaaaahhh...!
Hey, hey... T-Tohka! Please calm down!
Hey, you two! Cut it out already!
I'm sorry... I'm very sorry!

Shhhh...! Be quiet...! You're ruining
the movie...!
I-I'm sorry...

(We exited to the lobby amidst piercing glares
from our surroundings...)

Hm... Why do I always end up doing
something like this?

Don't let it get to you so much. It was your
first movie. It can't be helped that you'd get
super touched by the story.
Sh-Shido... have you become infatuated with me?
Wh-Wh—?

I-It is nothing! Forget about it!
I apologize, but I'll head home first...!
H-Hey! Tohka...!

(Hmmm... did I mess up with the movie selection?
It looked like she was enjoying it, but maybe it
was pushing it to ask Tohka to stay quiet...)
Hey... Tohka's mental state's gotten pretty\nunstable, you know?

Well... She cried a lot towards the end and we got
scolded. She seems depressed because of that...
Hmmm... So then, it was a real\ntear-jerker, was it?
Right. The one called "One Week Left".
...While her mental graph gets tense halfway,\nher enjoyment metrics scored really high. It\nlooks like you had the right idea, at least.
I-I wonder...
It's just that your guidance and support skills\nwere lacking.
―Urgh!
Conversely... You could say we made it through\n with just this outcome because it was you,\nShido.
Huh...?

You're really dense... Speaking of which,
what's Tohka doing?"	
Message	Shido	"W-Well, she said she'd go home first,
so she left by herself―
Why didn't you say so?! Didn't I tell you that we\ncan't monitor your positional info from here?!\nFind her right now and follow up, dumbass!
You're right... I have to support Tohka.

(Yeah, since Tohka is fine with... and in fact,
has fun with... tests of courage, she might
like this...)

(The problem is what kind of horror movie they're
showing. Hm... That, huh...? It looks like your
average "B-movie", but...)
All right, Tohka, let's go see that!

Hm...while watching a movie...
graceful and reserved...
Heeeey, Tohka?
...H-Hmmm?! Wh-Wh-What's wrong, Shido?!

Ah, nothing. I was just saying I decided which
movie we should watch.

Hm?! I-I see! I am good with anything
as long as I can watch it with you, Shido!

Uh...! Er... I-I'm sure you'll enjoy
it too, Tohka.

Umm, I don't know the details, but it's a horror
film called "Guilty Land".

Just a while ago we did something that was sort
of like a test of courage, right? It's sort of
like that, it's kind of a scary movie...

It's scary? I'm curious as to what it's like!
Then, let us hurry and go!

W-Wait just a sec!
We're gonna go buy popcorn and drinks, right?
Ah! That's right!

It looks like we still have time until the movie
starts, so let's head to the concession stand.
Yes!

(The movie smelled of B-grade stuff right off the
bat, but it's surprisingly enjoyable.)

(Nine college students enter a burned-down
building to test their courage. The performance is
strangely engaging, with a true feeling of fear.)

(Tohka, who seemed restless at first, had her eyes
glued to the screen, as if she were worried she'd
miss a second of it.)

(The abandoned building used to be a hospital.
In a gloomy room lit only by candles, something
attacked a couple. Its hands gripped a syringe―
Ah... E-Eeek...!
Wh-What's wrong...! Tohka...?!
N-No... Stop...!
H-Hey! Tohka! A-Are you okay...?!

D...Don't come any closer...! Go away, go away, go
away...!
N...N...No... EEEEEEEEEEK!!!!
T-Tohka?!?!

(My vision was filled with a white light, and it
was there my consciousness was severed.)

...In this dream... no one can become happy...
Shido Itsuka... I hope your next dream will be
a happy one...
